content.description: Slight overhang, upper section has some slight slopers
content.protection: Bolts are placed at the top if you are setting up a Top Rope. Be careful of rope drag over the edge
content.location: Walk up the trail to the slanted ledge Climb straight up the step-face to the broken part of the overhang, and traverse right 5 feet to a vertical crack. Climb the crack to the top.

content.description: Crux is a slight overhang. The rock has lichen all over it so the holds are really dusty. Climb up the face and through the overhang above. This will be just below the Zig-Zag crack. Climb the crack to the top.
content.location: Use the water trail to get to the top or do a rock scramble up to the block. Right of Zig route. At the botton of the slabs. You can also hike in from the top so you can set up the anchors.

content.description: Start at the far left of Riverview Ledge. Climb the overhang, and climb the broken rock and crack in a gully to the top.
content.protection: There are three cold shuts at the top of this climb
content.location: The far left of Riverview Ledge

content.description: The lead up to the crux is pretty easy and straightforward, lots of holds and jugs. The crux is climbing through the overhang. Above the crux is less than vertical and pretty chill.
content.protection: Tie off to a tree and a rock. Cracks for gear are hard to find because of dirt and needles.
content.location: Start: Same start Bellyflop. Climb the corner to the overhang. Climb through the overhang. Do not use the face on the left or the block on the right. Continue to the top.

content.description: Pretty straight forward. The only weird part is getting out from the overhang, especially if you are tall.
content.protection: Tree at the top makes a good tie off point. Cracks for cams or nuts are hard to find because they fill with dirt or needles. Able to tie off on rocks.
content.location: Start: Scramble up the chossy rocky trail on the south end of the rock to the base of the south face at a dirt ledge. Alternately, you can climb up the shrimp scampered crack wall to the ledge. Begin the climb in a large broken corner on the left. Climb the corner and step left around the overhang to the top.

content.description: The is the climb directly up the center of The Block above Riverview Ledge. I've led it 30-50 times over the last decade, I'm sure other people have done it, but I don't see it that often.
content.protection: Start in the center of Riverview Ledge under the overhanging roof. Stick a purple Camalot in the well-worn horizontal crack at the lip of the roof. Start to the left and move up and across the overhanging face, sticking a red Camalot in another horizontal as you move up. Pull up and right around the roof and gain a large ledge at the right side of The Block. Place a small nut at eye level and put a long sling on it. Step way to the left on tiny ledges to gain the black vertical crack splitting the center of The Block. Climb straight up on bomber jugs. Gear everywhere. Have fun!
content.location: Great gear. You can do this with a purple, red, and large yellow Camalot and one copper BD nut. Lots of options for additional pieces, but these are the keys. At the top there is a great crack to build your own anchor. You'll need long slings to get back over the edge though.

content.description: This is the large block directly above Riverview Ledge. It is basically the second pitch for all the climbs on the Main Wall.
